result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Nelson Rodgers

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Defendant Scott Nelson Rodgers in court.  Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Scott Nelson Rodgers.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.   Return on competency. Report received.  Parties stip to the findings in the report.  Court finds DE is competent to proceed.  Complaint received and reading waived. Court finds probable cause.  NG plea entered.  STC 11/30 930am.   Bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.  This case has been assigned to Judge Dougvillo.
